summary.long: 1 Chronicles is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech, Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Noah:
Shem, Ham and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Japheth:
Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Gomer:
Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Javan:
Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ham:
Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Cush:
Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah and Sabteka.
The sons of Raamah:
Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cush was the father of
Nimrod, who became a mighty warrior on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt was the father of
the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canaan was the father of
Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shem:
Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram.
The sons of Aram:
Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arphaxad was the father of Shelah,
and Shelah the father of Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Two sons were born to Eber:
one was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joktan was the father of
Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Serug, Nahor, Terah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Abram (that is, Abraham).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Abraham:
Isaac and Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were their descendants:
Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine:
Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah.
The sons of Jokshan:
Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Midian:
Ephah, Epher, Hanok, Abida and Eldaah.
All these were descendants of Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abraham was the father of Isaac.
The sons of Isaac:
Esau and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Esau:
Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Reuel:
Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Seir:
Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Lotan:
Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shobal:
Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam.
The sons of Zibeon:
Aiah and Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Anah:
Dishon.
The sons of Dishon:
Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran and Keran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ezer:
Bilhan, Zaavan and Akan.
The sons of Dishan:
Uz and Aran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the kings who reigned in Edom before any Israelite king reigned:
Bela son of Beor, whose city was named Dinhabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king. His city was named Avith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the river succeeded him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan son of Akbor succeeded him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad succeeded him as king. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-Zahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hadad also died.
The chiefs of Edom were:
Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Magdiel and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the sons of Israel:
Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Judah:
Er, Onan and Shelah. These three were born to him by a Canaanite woman, the daughter of Shua. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the Lord’s sight; so the Lord put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah’s daughter-in-law Tamar bore Perez and Zerah to Judah. He had five sons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Perez:
Hezron and Hamul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Zerah:
Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Kalkol and Darda – five in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Karmi:
Achar, who brought trouble on Israel by violating the ban on taking devoted things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Ethan:
Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons born to Hezron were:
Jerahmeel, Ram and Caleb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ram was the father of
Amminadab, and Amminadab the father of Nahshon, the leader of the people of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nahshon was the father of Salmon, Salmon the father of Boaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boaz the father of Obed and Obed the father of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesse was the father of
Eliab his firstborn; the second son was Abinadab, the third Shimea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth Nethanel, the fifth Raddai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixth Ozem and the seventh David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah’s three sons were Abishai, Joab and Asahel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah (and by Jerioth). These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab and Ardon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri the father of Bezalel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Hezron, when he was sixty years old, married the daughter of Makir the father of Gilead. He made love to her, and she bore him Segub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Segub was the father of Jair, who controlled twenty-three towns in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth Jair, as well as Kenath with its surrounding settlements – sixty towns.) All these were descendants of Makir the father of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Hezron died in Caleb Ephrathah, Abijah the wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron:
Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel:
Maaz, Jamin and Eker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Onam:
Shammai and Jada.
The sons of Shammai:
Nadab and Abishur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Nadab:
Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Appaim:
Ishi, who was the father of Sheshan.
Sheshan was the father of Ahlai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother:
Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jonathan:
Peleth and Zaza.
These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheshan had no sons – only daughters.
He had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore him Attai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Attai was the father of Nathan,
Nathan the father of Zabad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zabad the father of Ephlal,
Ephlal the father of Obed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Obed the father of Jehu,
Jehu the father of Azariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azariah the father of Helez,
Helez the father of Eleasah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eleasah the father of Sismai,
Sismai the father of Shallum,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shallum the father of Jekamiah,
and Jekamiah the father of Elishama.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel:
Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and his son Mareshah, who was the father of Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Hebron:
Korah, Tappuah, Rekem and Shema.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shema was the father of Raham, and Raham the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb’s concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jahdai:
Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb’s concubine Maakah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah and to Sheva the father of Makbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Aksah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the descendants of Caleb.
The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah:
Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim were:
Haroeh, half the Manahathites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the clans of Kiriath Jearim: the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Salma:
Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the Rekabites.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the third, Absalom the son of Maakah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur;
the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital;
and the sixth, Ithream, by his wife Eglah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These six were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned seven years and six months.
David reigned in Jerusalem for thirty-three years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and these were the children born to him there:
Shammua, Shobab, Nathan and Solomon. These four were by Bathsheba daughter of Ammiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also Ibhar, Elishua, Eliphelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Eliada and Eliphelet – nine in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of David, besides his sons by his concubines. And Tamar was their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Solomon’s son was Rehoboam,
Abijah his son,
Asa his son,
Jehoshaphat his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jehoram his son,
Ahaziah his son,
Joash his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amaziah his son,
Azariah his son,
Jotham his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahaz his son,
Hezekiah his son,
Manasseh his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amon his son,
Josiah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Josiah:
Johanan the firstborn,
Jehoiakim the second son,
Zedekiah the third,
Shallum the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The successors of Jehoiakim:
Jehoiachin his son,
and Zedekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Jehoiachin the captive:
Shealtiel his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama and Nedabiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Pedaiah:
Zerubbabel and Shimei.
The sons of Zerubbabel:
Meshullam and Hananiah.
Shelomith was their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There were also five others:
Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah and Jushab-Hesed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Hananiah:
Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, and the sons of Rephaiah, of Arnan, of Obadiah and of Shekaniah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Shekaniah:
Shemaiah and his sons:
Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah and Shaphat – six in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Neariah:
Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam – three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Elioenai:
Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani – seven in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Judah:
Perez, Hezron, Karmi, Hur and Shobal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reaiah son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the sons of Etam:
Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash. Their sister was named Hazzelelponi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah.
These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and father of Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the descendants of Naarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Helah:
Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Koz, who was the father of Anub and Hazzobebah and of the clans of Aharhel son of Harum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jabez was more honourable than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, saying, ‘I gave birth to him in pain.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jabez cried out to the God of Israel, ‘Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain.’ And God granted his request.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kelub, Shuhah’s brother, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Rekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kenaz:
Othniel and Seraiah.
The sons of Othniel:
Hathath and Meonothai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meonothai was the father of Ophrah.
Seraiah was the father of Joab,
the father of Ge Harashim. It was called this because its people were skilled workers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh:
Iru, Elah and Naam.
The son of Elah:
Kenaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jehallelel:
Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ezrah:
Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon. One of Mered’s wives gave birth to Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (His wife from the tribe of Judah gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soko, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the children of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithiah, whom Mered had married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham:
the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maakathite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shimon:
Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan and Tilon.
The descendants of Ishi:
Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shelah son of Judah:
Er the father of Lekah, Laadah the father of Mareshah and the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokim, the men of Kozeba, and Joash and Saraph, who ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. (These records are from ancient times.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were the potters who lived at Netaim and Gederah; they stayed there and worked for the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Simeon:
Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah and Shaul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum was Shaul’s son, Mibsam his son and Mishma his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Mishma:
Hammuel his son, Zakkur his son and Shimei his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children; so their entire clan did not become as numerous as the people of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Markaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri and Shaaraim. These were their towns until the reign of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their surrounding villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token and Ashan – five towns –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the villages around these towns as far as Baalath. These were their settlements. And they kept a genealogical record.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ziza son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men listed above by name were leaders of their clans. Their families increased greatly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they went to the outskirts of Gedor to the east of the valley in search of pasture for their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found rich, good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful and quiet. Some Hamites had lived there formerly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men whose names were listed came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They attacked the Hamites in their dwellings and also the Meunites who were there and completely destroyed them, as is evident to this day. Then they settled in their place, because there was pasture for their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And five hundred of these Simeonites, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, invaded the hill country of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They killed the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father’s marriage bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel; so he could not be listed in the genealogical record in accordance with his birthright,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and though Judah was the strongest of his brothers and a ruler came from him, the rights of the firstborn belonged to Joseph) –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel:
Hanok, Pallu, Hezron and Karmi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Joel:
Shemaiah his son, Gog his son,
Shimei his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Micah his son,
Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their relatives by clans, listed according to their genealogical records:
Jeiel the chief, Zechariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Bela son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel. They settled in the area from Aroer to Nebo and Baal Meon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the east they occupied the land up to the edge of the desert that extends to the River Euphrates, because their livestock had increased in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During Saul’s reign they waged war against the Hagrites, who were defeated at their hands; they occupied the dwellings of the Hagrites throughout the entire region east of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Gadites lived next to them in Bashan, as far as Salekah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel was the chief, Shapham the second, then Janai and Shaphat, in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their relatives, by families, were:
Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jakan, Zia and Eber – seven in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahi son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Gadites lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its outlying villages, and on all the pasture-lands of Sharon as far as they extended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were entered in the genealogical records during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men ready for military service – able-bodied men who could handle shield and sword, who could use a bow, and who were trained for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They waged war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were helped in fighting them, and God delivered the Hagrites and all their allies into their hands, because they cried out to him during the battle. He answered their prayers, because they trusted in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They seized the livestock of the Hagrites – fifty thousand camels, two hundred and fifty thousand sheep and two thousand donkeys. They also took one hundred thousand people captive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many others fell slain, because the battle was God’s. And they occupied the land until the exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the half-tribe of Manasseh were numerous; they settled in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon, that is, to Senir (Mount Hermon).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the heads of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah and Jahdiel. They were brave warriors, famous men, and heads of their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were unfaithful to the God of their ancestors and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria (that is, Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria), who took the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile. He took them to Halah, Habor, Hara and the river of Gozan, where they are to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Levi:
Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kohath:
Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of Amram:
Aaron, Moses and Miriam.
The sons of Aaron:
Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eleazar was the father of Phinehas,
Phinehas the father of Abishua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abishua the father of Bukki,
Bukki the father of Uzzi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uzzi the father of Zerahiah,
Zerahiah the father of Meraioth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meraioth the father of Amariah,
Amariah the father of Ahitub,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahitub the father of Zadok,
Zadok the father of Ahimaaz,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahimaaz the father of Azariah,
Azariah the father of Johanan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan the father of Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the temple Solomon built in Jerusalem),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azariah the father of Amariah,
Amariah the father of Ahitub,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahitub the father of Zadok,
Zadok the father of Shallum,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shallum the father of Hilkiah,
Hilkiah the father of Azariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azariah the father of Seraiah,
and Seraiah the father of Jozadak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jozadak was deported when the Lord sent Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Levi:
Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the names of the sons of Gershon:
Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kohath:
Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari:
Mahli and Mushi.
These are the clans of the Levites listed according to their fathers:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
of Gershon:
Libni his son, Jahath his son,
Zimmah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joah his son,
Iddo his son, Zerah his son
and Jeatherai his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Kohath:
Amminadab his son, Korah his son,
Assir his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Elkanah his son,
Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tahath his son, Uriel his son,
Uzziah his son and Shaul his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Elkanah:
Amasai, Ahimoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Elkanah his son, Zophai his son,
Nahath his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eliab his son,
Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son
and Samuel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Samuel:
Joel the firstborn
and Abijah the second son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Merari:
Mahli, Libni his son,
Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shimea his son, Haggiah his son
and Asaiah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men David put in charge of the music in the house of the Lord after the ark came to rest there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ministered with music before the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, until Solomon built the temple of the Lord in Jerusalem. They performed their duties according to the regulations laid down for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Here are the men who served, together with their sons:
from the Kohathites:
Heman, the musician,
the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham,
the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah,
the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel,
the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Tahath, the son of Assir,
the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath,
the son of Levi, the son of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and Heman’s associate Asaph, who served at his right hand:
Asaph son of Berekiah, the son of Shimea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah,
the son of Malkijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Ethni,
the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah,
the son of Shimei,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Jahath,
the son of Gershon, the son of Levi;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and from their associates, the Merarites, at his left hand:
Ethan son of Kishi, the son of Abdi,
the son of Malluk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Hashabiah,
the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Amzi, the son of Bani,
the son of Shemer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Mahli,
the son of Mushi, the son of Merari,
the son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their fellow Levites were assigned to all the other duties of the tabernacle, the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Aaron and his descendants were the ones who presented offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense in connection with all that was done in the Most Holy Place, making atonement for Israel, in accordance with all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the descendants of Aaron:
Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son,
Abishua his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bukki his son,
Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meraioth his son, Amariah his son,
Ahitub his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zadok his son
and Ahimaaz his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the locations of their settlements allotted as their territory (they were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clan, because the first lot was for them):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were given Hebron in Judah with its surrounding pasture-lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fields and villages around the city were given to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the descendants of Aaron were given Hebron (a city of refuge), and Libnah, Jattir, Eshtemoa,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilen, Debir,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashan, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasture-lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And from the tribe of Benjamin they were given Gibeon, Geba, Alemeth and Anathoth, together with their pasture-lands.
The total number of towns distributed among the Kohathite clans came to thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of Kohath’s descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of half the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gershon, clan by clan, were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Issachar, Asher and Naphtali, and from the part of the tribe of Manasseh that is in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Merari, clan by clan, were allotted twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelites gave the Levites these towns and their pasture-lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin they allotted the previously named towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Kohathite clans were given as their territory towns from the tribe of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge), and Gezer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokmeam, Beth Horon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasture-lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from half the tribe of Manasseh the Israelites gave Aner and Bileam, together with their pasture-lands, to the rest of the Kohathite clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
from the tribe of Issachar
they received Kedesh, Daberath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ramoth and Anem, together with their pasture-lands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the tribe of Asher
they received Mashal, Abdon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hukok and Rehob, together with their pasture-lands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and from the tribe of Naphtali
they received Kedesh in Galilee, Hammon and Kiriathaim, together with their pasture-lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
from the tribe of Reuben across the Jordan east of Jericho
they received Bezer in the wilderness, Jahzah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth and Mephaath, together with their pasture-lands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and from the tribe of Gad
they received Ramoth in Gilead, Mahanaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon and Jazer, together with their pasture-lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Issachar:
Tola, Puah, Jashub and Shimron – four in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Tola:
Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam and Samuel – heads of their families. During the reign of David, the descendants of Tola listed as fighting men in their genealogy numbered 22,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Uzzi:
Izrahiah.
The sons of Izrahiah:
Michael, Obadiah, Joel and Ishiah. All five of them were chiefs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to their family genealogy, they had 36,000 men ready for battle, for they had many wives and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The relatives who were fighting men belonging to all the clans of Issachar, as listed in their genealogy, were 87,000 in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Three sons of Benjamin:
Bela, Beker and Jediael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Bela:
Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth and Iri, heads of families – five in all. Their genealogical record listed 22,034 fighting men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Beker:
Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Beker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their genealogical record listed the heads of families and 20,200 fighting men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Jediael:
Bilhan.
The sons of Bilhan:
Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these sons of Jediael were heads of families. There were 17,200 fighting men ready to go out to war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Shuppites and Huppites were the descendants of Ir, and the Hushites the descendants of Aher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Naphtali:
Jahziel, Guni, Jezer and Shillem – the descendants of Bilhah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Manasseh:
Asriel was his descendant through his Aramean concubine. She gave birth to Makir the father of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Makir took a wife from among the Huppites and Shuppites. His sister’s name was Maakah.
Another descendant was named Zelophehad, who had only daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Makir’s wife Maakah gave birth to a son and named him Peresh. His brother was named Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Ulam:
Bedan.
These were the sons of Gilead son of Makir, the son of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer and Mahlah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shemida were:
Ahian, Shechem, Likhi and Aniam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Ephraim:
Shuthelah, Bered his son,
Tahath his son, Eleadah his son,
Tahath his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zabad his son
and Shuthelah his son.
Ezer and Elead were killed by the native-born men of Gath, when they went down to seize their livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their father Ephraim mourned for them many days, and his relatives came to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made love to his wife again, and she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. He named him Beriah, because there had been misfortune in his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon as well as Uzzen Sheerah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rephah was his son, Resheph his son,
Telah his son, Tahan his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ladan his son, Ammihud his son,
Elishama his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nun his son
and Joshua his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their lands and settlements included Bethel and its surrounding villages, Naaran to the east, Gezer and its villages to the west, and Shechem and its villages all the way to Ayyah and its villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along the borders of Manasseh were Beth Shan, Taanach, Megiddo and Dor, together with their villages. The descendants of Joseph son of Israel lived in these towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Asher:
Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi and Beriah. Their sister was Serah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Beriah:
Heber and Malkiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer and Hotham and of their sister Shua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Japhlet:
Pasak, Bimhal and Ashvath.
These were Japhlet’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shomer:
Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah and Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of his brother Helem:
Zophah, Imna, Shelesh and Amal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Zophah:
Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran and Beera.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jether:
Jephunneh, Pispah and Ara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ulla:
Arah, Hanniel and Rizia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were descendants of Asher – heads of families, choice men, brave warriors and outstanding leaders. The number of men ready for battle, as listed in their genealogy, was 26,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Benjamin was the father of Bela his firstborn,
Ashbel the second son, Aharah the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nohah the fourth and Rapha the fifth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Bela were:
Addar, Gera, Abihud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gera, Shephuphan and Huram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Ehud, who were heads of families of those living in Geba and were deported to Manahath:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naaman, Ahijah and Gera, who deported them and who was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons were born to Shaharaim in Moab after he had divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his wife Hodesh he had Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malkam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeuz, Sakia and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By Hushim he had Abitub and Elpaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Elpaal:
Eber, Misham, Shemed (who built Ono and Lod with its surrounding villages),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Beriah and Shema, who were heads of families of those living in Aijalon and who drove out the inhabitants of Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Michael, Ishpah and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jakim, Zikri, Zabdi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adaiah, Beraiah and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abdon, Zikri, Hanan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphdeiah and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jaareshiah, Elijah and Zikri were the sons of Jeroham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were heads of families, chiefs as listed in their genealogy, and they lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon.
His wife’s name was Maakah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, Zeker
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mikloth, who was the father of Shimeah. They too lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ner was the father of Kish, Kish the father of Saul, and Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab and Esh-Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Jonathan:
Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Micah:
Pithon, Melek, Tarea and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah, Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moza was the father of Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son and Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azel had six sons, and these were their names:
Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of his brother Eshek:
Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second son and Eliphelet the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ulam were brave warriors who could handle the bow. They had many sons and grandsons – 150 in all.
All these were the descendants of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel was listed in the genealogies in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah. They were taken captive to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first to resettle on their own property in their own towns were some Israelites, priests, Levites and temple servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those from Judah, from Benjamin, and from Ephraim and Manasseh who lived in Jerusalem were:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uthai son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, a descendant of Perez son of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the Shelanites:
Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the Zerahites:
Jeuel.
The people from Judah numbered 690.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the Benjaminites:
Sallu son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi, the son of Mikri; and Meshullam son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people from Benjamin, as listed in their genealogy, numbered 956. All these men were heads of their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the priests:
Jedaiah; Jehoiarib; Jakin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the official in charge of the house of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adaiah son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malkijah; and Maasai son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests, who were heads of families, numbered 1,760. They were able men, responsible for ministering in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the Levites:
Shemaiah son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, a Merarite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal and Mattaniah son of Mika, the son of Zikri, the son of Asaph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obadiah son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berekiah son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The gatekeepers:
Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman and their fellow Levites, Shallum their chief
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: being stationed at the King’s Gate on the east, up to the present time. These were the gatekeepers belonging to the camp of the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his fellow gatekeepers from his family (the Korahites) were responsible for guarding the thresholds of the tent just as their ancestors had been responsible for guarding the entrance to the dwelling of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar was the official in charge of the gatekeepers, and the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds numbered 212. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. The gatekeepers had been assigned to their positions of trust by David and Samuel the seer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They and their descendants were in charge of guarding the gates of the house of the Lord – the house called the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gatekeepers were on the four sides: east, west, north and south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their fellow Levites in their villages had to come from time to time and share their duties for seven-day periods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the four principal gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the responsibility for the rooms and treasuries in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would spend the night stationed round the house of God, because they had to guard it; and they had charge of the key for opening it each morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were in charge of the articles used in the temple service; they counted them when they were brought in and when they were taken out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others were assigned to take care of the furnishings and all the other articles of the sanctuary, as well as the special flour and wine, and the olive oil, incense and spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the priests took care of mixing the spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Levite named Mattithiah, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with the responsibility for baking the offering bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Kohathites, their fellow Levites, were in charge of preparing for every Sabbath the bread set out on the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were musicians, heads of Levite families, stayed in the rooms of the temple and were exempt from other duties because they were responsible for the work day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were heads of Levite families, chiefs as listed in their genealogy, and they lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon.
His wife’s name was Maakah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah and Mikloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They too lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ner was the father of Kish, Kish the father of Saul, and Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab and Esh-Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Jonathan:
Merib-Baal, who was the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Micah:
Pithon, Melek, Tahrea and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz was the father of Jadah, Jadah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri, and Zimri was the father of Moza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moza was the father of Binea; Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son and Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azel had six sons, and these were their names:
Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; the Israelites fled before them, and many fell dead on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines were in hot pursuit of Saul and his sons, and they killed his sons Jonathan, Abinadab and Malki-Shua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fighting grew fierce around Saul, and when the archers overtook him, they wounded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saul said to his armour-bearer, ‘Draw your sword and run me through, or these uncircumcised fellows will come and abuse me.’
But his armour-bearer was terrified and would not do it; so Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the armour-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul and his three sons died, and all his house died together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the Israelites in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons had died, they abandoned their towns and fled. And the Philistines came and occupied them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip the dead, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stripped him and took his head and his armour, and sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines to proclaim the news among their idols and their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put his armour in the temple of their gods and hung up his head in the temple of Dagon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all their valiant men went and took the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. Then they buried their bones under the great tree in Jabesh, and they fasted seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul died because he was unfaithful to the Lord; he did not keep the word of the Lord and even consulted a medium for guidance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and did not enquire of the Lord. So the Lord put him to death and turned the kingdom over to David son of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel came together to David at Hebron and said, ‘We are your own flesh and blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the past, even while Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel on their military campaigns. And the Lord your God said to you, “You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will become their ruler.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the elders of Israel had come to King David at Hebron, he made a covenant with them at Hebron before the Lord, and they anointed David king over Israel, as the Lord had promised through Samuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all the Israelites marched to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus). The Jebusites who lived there
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: said to David, ‘You will not get in here.’ Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion – which is the City of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David had said, ‘Whoever leads the attack on the Jebusites will become commander-in-chief.’ Joab son of Zeruiah went up first, and so he received the command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David then took up residence in the fortress, and so it was called the City of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built up the city around it, from the terraces to the surrounding wall, while Joab restored the rest of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David became more and more powerful, because the Lord Almighty was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the chiefs of David’s mighty warriors – they, together with all Israel, gave his kingship strong support to extend it over the whole land, as the Lord had promised –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
this is the list of David’s mighty warriors:
Jashobeam, a Hakmonite, was chief of the officers; he raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed in one encounter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodai the Ahohite, one of the three mighty warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. At a place where there was a field full of barley, the troops fled from the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they took their stand in the middle of the field. They defended it and struck the Philistines down, and the Lord brought about a great victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three of the thirty chiefs came down to David to the rock at the cave of Adullam, while a band of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David longed for water and said, ‘Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Three broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘God forbid that I should do this!’ he said. ‘Should I drink the blood of these men who went at the risk of their lives?’ Because they risked their lives to bring it back, David would not drink it.
Such were the exploits of the three mighty warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishai the brother of Joab was chief of the Three. He raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed, and so he became as famous as the Three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was doubly honoured above the Three and became their commander, even though he was not included among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada, a valiant fighter from Kabzeel, performed great exploits. He struck down Moab’s two mightiest warriors. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he struck down an Egyptian who was five cubits tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver’s rod in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club. He snatched the spear from the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; he too was as famous as the three mighty warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was held in greater honour than any of the Thirty, but he was not included among the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mighty warriors were:
Asahel the brother of Joab,
Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shammoth the Harorite,
Helez the Pelonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa,
Abiezer from Anathoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sibbekai the Hushathite,
Ilai the Ahohite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Maharai the Netophathite,
Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjamin,
Benaiah the Pirathonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hurai from the ravines of Gaash,
Abiel the Arbathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azmaveth the Baharumite,
Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sons of Hashem the Gizonite,
Jonathan son of Shagee the Hararite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahiam son of Sakar the Hararite,
Eliphal son of Ur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hepher the Mekerathite,
Ahijah the Pelonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hezro the Carmelite,
Naarai son of Ezbai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joel the brother of Nathan,
Mibhar son of Hagri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zelek the Ammonite,
Naharai the Berothite, the armour-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ira the Ithrite,
Gareb the Ithrite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uriah the Hittite,
Zabad son of Ahlai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, who was chief of the Reubenites, and the thirty with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hanan son of Maakah,
Joshaphat the Mithnite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uzzia the Ashterathite,
Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jediael son of Shimri,
his brother Joha the Tizite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eliel the Mahavite,
Jeribai and Joshaviah the sons of Elnaam,
Ithmah the Moabite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliel, Obed and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he was banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish (they were among the warriors who helped him in battle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they were armed with bows and were able to shoot arrows or to sling stones right-handed or left-handed; they were relatives of Saul from the tribe of Benjamin):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahiezer their chief and Joash the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet the sons of Azmaveth; Berakah, Jehu the Anathothite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty warrior among the Thirty, who was a leader of the Thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah and Shephatiah the Haruphite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elkanah, Ishiah, Azarel, Joezer and Jashobeam the Korahites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joelah and Zebadiah the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Gadites defected to David at his stronghold in the wilderness. They were brave warriors, ready for battle and able to handle the shield and spear. Their faces were the faces of lions, and they were as swift as gazelles in the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ezer was the chief,
Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah the tenth and Makbannai the eleventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These Gadites were army commanders; the least was a match for a hundred, and the greatest for a thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was they who crossed the Jordan in the first month when it was overflowing all its banks, and they put to flight everyone living in the valleys, to the east and to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other Benjaminites and some men from Judah also came to David in his stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David went out to meet them and said to them, ‘If you have come to me in peace to help me, I am ready for you to join me. But if you have come to betray me to my enemies when my hands are free from violence, may the God of our ancestors see it and judge you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Spirit came on Amasai, chief of the Thirty, and he said:
‘We are yours, David!
    We are with you, son of Jesse!
Success, success to you,
    and success to those who help you,
        for your God will help you.’
So David received them and made them leaders of his raiding bands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the tribe of Manasseh defected to David when he went with the Philistines to fight against Saul. (He and his men did not help the Philistines because, after consultation, their rulers sent him away. They said, ‘It will cost us our heads if he deserts to his master Saul.’)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David went to Ziklag, these were the men of Manasseh who defected to him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu and Zillethai, leaders of units of a thousand in Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They helped David against raiding bands, for all of them were brave warriors, and they were commanders in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Day after day men came to help David, until he had a great army, like the army of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbers of the men armed for battle who came to David at Hebron to turn Saul’s kingdom over to him, as the Lord had said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Judah, carrying shield and spear – 6,800 armed for battle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Simeon, warriors ready for battle – 7,100;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Levi – 4,600,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: including Jehoiada, leader of the family of Aaron, with 3,700 men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zadok, a brave young warrior, with 22 officers from his family;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Benjamin, Saul’s tribe – 3,000, most of whom had remained loyal to Saul’s house until then;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Ephraim, brave warriors, famous in their own clans – 20,800;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from half the tribe of Manasseh, designated by name to come and make David king – 18,000;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Issachar, men who understood the times and knew what Israel should do – 200 chiefs, with all their relatives under their command;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Zebulun, experienced soldiers prepared for battle with every type of weapon, to help David with undivided loyalty – 50,000;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Naphtali – 1,000 officers, together with 37,000 men carrying shields and spears;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Dan, ready for battle – 28,600;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from Asher, experienced soldiers prepared for battle – 40,000;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from east of the Jordan, from Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh, armed with every type of weapon – 120,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were fighting men who volunteered to serve in the ranks. They came to Hebron fully determined to make David king over all Israel. All the rest of the Israelites were also of one mind to make David king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men spent three days there with David, eating and drinking, for their families had supplied provisions for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, their neighbours from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun and Naphtali came bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules and oxen. There were plentiful supplies of flour, fig cakes, raisin cakes, wine, olive oil, cattle and sheep, for there was joy in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David conferred with each of his officers, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then said to the whole assembly of Israel, ‘If it seems good to you and if it is the will of the Lord our God, let us send word far and wide to the rest of our people throughout the territories of Israel, and also to the priests and Levites who are with them in their towns and pasture-lands, to come and join us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us bring the ark of our God back to us, for we did not enquire of it during the reign of Saul.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole assembly agreed to do this, because it seemed right to all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David assembled all Israel, from the River Shihor in Egypt to Lebo Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all Israel went to Baalah of Judah (Kiriath Jearim) to bring up from there the ark of God the Lord, who is enthroned between the cherubim – the ark that is called by the Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They moved the ark of God from Abinadab’s house on a new cart, with Uzzah and Ahio guiding it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all the Israelites were celebrating with all their might before God, with songs and with harps, lyres, tambourines, cymbals and trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the threshing-floor of Kidon, Uzzah reached out his hand to steady the ark, because the oxen stumbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord’s anger burned against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark. So he died there before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David was angry because the Lord’s wrath had broken out against Uzzah, and to this day that place is called Perez Uzzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was afraid of God that day and asked, ‘How can I ever bring the ark of God to me?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not take the ark to be with him in the City of David. Instead, he took it to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ark of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house for three months, and the Lord blessed his household and everything he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons and carpenters to build a palace for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David knew that the Lord had established him as king over Israel and that his kingdom had been highly exalted for the sake of his people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Jerusalem David took more wives and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the children born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Beeliada and Eliphelet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, they went up in full force to search for him, but David heard about it and went out to meet them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so David enquired of God: ‘Shall I go and attack the Philistines? Will you deliver them into my hands?’
The Lord answered him, ‘Go, I will deliver them into your hands.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and his men went up to Baal Perazim, and there he defeated them. He said, ‘As waters break out, God has broken out against my enemies by my hand.’ So that place was called Baal Perazim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines had abandoned their gods there, and David gave orders to burn them in the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once more the Philistines raided the valley;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so David enquired of God again, and God answered him, ‘Do not go directly after them, but circle round them and attack them in front of the poplar trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the poplar trees, move out to battle, because that will mean God has gone out in front of you to strike the Philistine army.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David did as God commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army, all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David’s fame spread throughout every land, and the Lord made all the nations fear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After David had constructed buildings for himself in the City of David, he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, ‘No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, because the Lord chose them to carry the ark of the Lord and to minister before him for ever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to the place he had prepared for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the descendants of Kohath,
Uriel the leader and 120 relatives;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the descendants of Merari,
Asaiah the leader and 220 relatives;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the descendants of Gershon,
Joel the leader and 130 relatives;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the descendants of Elizaphan,
Shemaiah the leader and 200 relatives;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the descendants of Hebron,
Eliel the leader and 80 relatives;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the descendants of Uzziel,
Amminadab the leader and 112 relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David summoned Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel and Amminadab the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, ‘You are the heads of the Levitical families; you and your fellow Levites are to consecrate yourselves and bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was because you, the Levites, did not bring it up the first time that the Lord our God broke out in anger against us. We did not enquire of him about how to do it in the prescribed way.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priests and Levites consecrated themselves in order to bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Levites carried the ark of God with the poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David told the leaders of the Levites to appoint their fellow Levites as musicians to make a joyful sound with musical instruments: lyres, harps and cymbals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; from his relatives, Asaph son of Berekiah; and from their relatives the Merarites, Ethan son of Kushaiah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with them their relatives next in rank: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The musicians Heman, Asaph and Ethan were to sound the bronze cymbals;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah and Benaiah were to play the lyres according to alamoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel and Azaziah were to play the harps, directing according to sheminith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenaniah the head Levite was in charge of the singing; that was his responsibility because he was skilful at it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Berekiah and Elkanah were to be doorkeepers for the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah and Eliezer the priests were to blow trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-Edom and Jehiah were also to be doorkeepers for the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David and the elders of Israel and the commanders of units of a thousand went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-Edom, with rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because God had helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the covenant of the Lord, seven bulls and seven rams were sacrificed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David was clothed in a robe of fine linen, as were all the Levites who were carrying the ark, and as were the musicians, and Kenaniah, who was in charge of the singing of the choirs. David also wore a linen ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with shouts, with the sounding of rams’ horns and trumpets, and of cymbals, and the playing of lyres and harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the ark of the covenant of the Lord was entering the City of David, Michal daughter of Saul watched from a window. And when she saw King David dancing and celebrating, she despised him in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they presented burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he gave a loaf of bread, a cake of dates and a cake of raisins to each Israelite man and woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the Lord, to extol, thank, and praise the Lord, the God of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asaph was the chief, and next to him in rank were Zechariah, then Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom and Jeiel. They were to play the lyres and harps, Asaph was to sound the cymbals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests were to blow the trumpets regularly before the ark of the covenant of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day David first appointed Asaph and his associates to give praise to the Lord in this manner:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give praise to the Lord, proclaim his name;
    make known among the nations what he has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to him, sing praise to him;
    tell of all his wonderful acts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glory in his holy name;
    let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look to the Lord and his strength;
    seek his face always.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember the wonders he has done,
    his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you his servants, the descendants of Israel,
    his chosen ones, the children of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Lord our God;
    his judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He remembers his covenant for ever,
    the promise he made, for a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the covenant he made with Abraham,
    the oath he swore to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree,
    to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘To you I will give the land of Canaan
    as the portion you will inherit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they were but few in number,
    few indeed, and strangers in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they wandered from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He allowed no one to oppress them;
    for their sake he rebuked kings:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Do not touch my anointed ones;
    do my prophets no harm.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth;
    proclaim his salvation day after day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    his marvellous deeds among all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is the Lord and most worthy of praise;
    he is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the nations are idols,
    but the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Splendour and majesty are before him;
    strength and joy are in his dwelling-place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
