Ascribe to the Lord, all you families of nations,
    ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble before him, all the earth!
    The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens rejoice, let the earth be glad;
    let them say among the nations, ‘The Lord reigns!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the sea resound, and all that is in it;
    let the fields be jubilant, and everything in them!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good;
    his love endures for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cry out, ‘Save us, God our Saviour;
    gather us and deliver us from the nations,
that we may give thanks to your holy name,
    and glory in your praise.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.
Then all the people said ‘Amen’ and ‘Praise the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David left Asaph and his associates before the ark of the covenant of the Lord to minister there regularly, according to each day’s requirements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also left Obed-Edom and his sixty-eight associates to minister with them. Obed-Edom son of Jeduthun, and also Hosah, were gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David left Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the tabernacle of the Lord at the high place in Gibeon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to present burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, in accordance with everything written in the Law of the Lord, which he had given Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the Lord, ‘for his love endures for ever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heman and Jeduthun were responsible for the sounding of the trumpets and cymbals and for the playing of the other instruments for sacred song. The sons of Jeduthun were stationed at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people left, each for their own home, and David returned home to bless his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After David was settled in his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, ‘Here I am, living in a house of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under a tent.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathan replied to David, ‘Whatever you have in mind, do it, for God is with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that night the word of God came to Nathan, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Go and tell my servant David, “This is what the Lord says: you are not the one to build me a house to dwell in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought Israel up out of Egypt to this day. I have moved from one tent site to another, from one dwelling-place to another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever I have moved with all the Israelites, did I ever say to any of their leaders whom I commanded to shepherd my people, ‘Why have you not built me a house of cedar?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Now then, tell my servant David, “This is what the Lord Almighty says: I took you from the pasture, from tending the flock, and appointed you ruler over my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make your name like the names of the greatest men on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will provide a place for my people Israel and will plant them so that they can have a home of their own and no longer be disturbed. Wicked people will not oppress them any more, as they did at the beginning
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and have done ever since the time I appointed leaders over my people Israel. I will also subdue all your enemies.
‘“I declare to you that the Lord will build a house for you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when your days are over and you go to be with your ancestors, I will raise up your offspring to succeed you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one who will build a house for me, and I will establish his throne for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will never take my love away from him, as I took it away from your predecessor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set him over my house and my kingdom for ever; his throne will be established for ever.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathan reported to David all the words of this entire revelation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then King David went in and sat before the Lord, and he said:
‘Who am I, Lord God, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as if this were not enough in your sight, my God, you have spoken about the future of the house of your servant. You, Lord God, have looked on me as though I were the most exalted of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘What more can David say to you for honouring your servant? For you know your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord. For the sake of your servant and according to your will, you have done this great thing and made known all these great promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘There is no one like you, Lord, and there is no God but you, as we have heard with our own ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who is like your people Israel – the one nation on earth whose God went out to redeem a people for himself, and to make a name for yourself, and to perform great and awesome wonders by driving out nations from before your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You made your people Israel your very own for ever, and you, Lord, have become their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And now, Lord, let the promise you have made concerning your servant and his house be established for ever. Do as you promised,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that it will be established and that your name will be great for ever. Then people will say, “The Lord Almighty, the God over Israel, is Israel’s God!” And the house of your servant David will be established before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build a house for him. So your servant has found courage to pray to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, Lord, are God! You have promised these good things to your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you have been pleased to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue for ever in your sight; for you, Lord, have blessed it, and it will be blessed for ever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the course of time, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Gath and its surrounding villages from the control of the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David also defeated the Moabites, and they became subject to him and brought him tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, David defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah, in the vicinity of Hamath, when he went to set up his monument at the River Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David captured a thousand of his chariots, seven thousand charioteers and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He hamstrung all but a hundred of the chariot horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put garrisons in the Aramean kingdom of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to him and brought him tribute. The Lord gave David victory wherever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took the gold shields carried by the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Tebah and Kun, towns that belonged to Hadadezer, David took a great quantity of bronze, which Solomon used to make the bronze Sea, the pillars and various bronze articles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and congratulate him on his victory in battle over Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. Hadoram brought all kinds of articles of gold, of silver and of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David dedicated these articles to the Lord, as he had done with the silver and gold he had taken from all these nations: Edom and Moab, the Ammonites and the Philistines, and Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishai son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became subject to David. The Lord gave David victory wherever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David reigned over all Israel, doing what was just and right for all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelek son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was secretary;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David’s sons were chief officials at the king’s side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the course of time, Nahash king of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David thought, ‘I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.’ So David sent a delegation to express his sympathy to Hanun concerning his father.
When David’s envoys came to Hanun in the land of the Ammonites to express sympathy to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Ammonite commanders said to Hanun, ‘Do you think David is honouring your father by sending envoys to you to express sympathy? Haven’t his envoys come to you only to explore and spy out the country and overthrow it?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hanun seized David’s envoys, shaved them, cut off their garments at the buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When someone came and told David about the men, he sent messengers to meet them, for they were greatly humiliated. The king said, ‘Stay at Jericho till your beards have grown, and then come back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Ammonites realised that they had become obnoxious to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and charioteers from Aram Naharaim, Aram Maakah and Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hired thirty-two thousand chariots and charioteers, as well as the king of Maakah with his troops, who came and camped near Medeba, while the Ammonites were mustered from their towns and moved out for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On hearing this, David sent Joab out with the entire army of fighting men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle formation at the entrance to their city, while the kings who had come were by themselves in the open country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab saw that there were battle lines in front of him and behind him; so he selected some of the best troops in Israel and deployed them against the Arameans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He put the rest of the men under the command of Abishai his brother, and they were deployed against the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab said, ‘If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you are to rescue me; but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will rescue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong, and let us fight bravely for our people and the cities of our God. The Lord will do what is good in his sight.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joab and the troops with him advanced to fight the Arameans, and they fled before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Ammonites realised that the Arameans were fleeing, they too fled before his brother Abishai and went inside the city. So Joab went back to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they sent messengers and had Arameans brought from beyond the River Euphrates, with Shophak the commander of Hadadezer’s army leading them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was told of this, he gathered all Israel and crossed the Jordan; he advanced against them and formed his battle lines opposite them. David formed his lines to meet the Arameans in battle, and they fought against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand of their foot soldiers. He also killed Shophak the commander of their army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been routed by Israel, they made peace with David and became subject to him.
So the Arameans were not willing to help the Ammonites any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the spring, at the time when kings go off to war, Joab led out the armed forces. He laid waste the land of the Ammonites and went to Rabbah and besieged it, but David remained in Jerusalem. Joab attacked Rabbah and left it in ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took the crown from the head of their king – its weight was found to be a talent of gold, and it was set with precious stones – and it was placed on David’s head. He took a great quantity of plunder from the city
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought out the people who were there, consigning them to labour with saws and with iron picks and axes. David did this to all the Ammonite towns. Then David and his entire army returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the course of time, war broke out with the Philistines, at Gezer. At that time Sibbekai the Hushathite killed Sippai, one of the descendants of the Rephaites, and the Philistines were subjugated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In another battle with the Philistines, Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, who had a spear with a shaft like a weaver’s rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In still another battle, which took place at Gath, there was a huge man with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot – twenty-four in all. He also was descended from Rapha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were descendants of Rapha in Gath, and they fell at the hands of David and his men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Satan rose up against Israel and incited David to take a census of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David said to Joab and the commanders of the troops, ‘Go and count the Israelites from Beersheba to Dan. Then report back to me so that I may know how many there are.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joab replied, ‘May the Lord multiply his troops a hundred times over. My lord the king, are they not all my lord’s subjects? Why does my lord want to do this? Why should he bring guilt on Israel?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king’s word, however, overruled Joab; so Joab left and went throughout Israel and then came back to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab reported the number of the fighting men to David: in all Israel there were one million one hundred thousand men who could handle a sword, including four hundred and seventy thousand in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joab did not include Levi and Benjamin in the numbering, because the king’s command was repulsive to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This command was also evil in the sight of God; so he punished Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to God, ‘I have sinned greatly by doing this. Now, I beg you, take away the guilt of your servant. I have done a very foolish thing.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Gad, David’s seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Go and tell David, “This is what the Lord says: I am giving you three options. Choose one of them for me to carry out against you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad went to David and said to him, ‘This is what the Lord says: “Take your choice:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three years of famine, three months of being swept away before your enemies, with their swords overtaking you, or three days of the sword of the Lord – days of plague in the land, with the angel of the Lord ravaging every part of Israel.” Now then, decide how I should answer the one who sent me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Gad, ‘I am in deep distress. Let me fall into the hands of the Lord, for his mercy is very great; but do not let me fall into human hands.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord sent a plague on Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem. But as the angel was doing so, the Lord saw it and relented concerning the disaster and said to the angel who was destroying the people, ‘Enough! Withdraw your hand.’ The angel of the Lord was then standing at the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David looked up and saw the angel of the Lord standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand extended over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell face down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to God, ‘Was it not I who ordered the fighting men to be counted? I, the shepherd, have sinned and done wrong. These are but sheep. What have they done? Lord my God, let your hand fall on me and my family, but do not let this plague remain on your people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord ordered Gad to tell David to go up and build an altar to the Lord on the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went up in obedience to the word that Gad had spoken in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Araunah was threshing wheat, he turned and saw the angel; his four sons who were with him hid themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David approached, and when Araunah looked and saw him, he left the threshing-floor and bowed down before David with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to him, ‘Let me have the site of your threshing-floor so that I can build an altar to the Lord, that the plague on the people may be stopped. Sell it to me at the full price.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Araunah said to David, ‘Take it! Let my lord the king do whatever pleases him. Look, I will give the oxen for the burnt offerings, the threshing-sledges for the wood, and the wheat for the grain offering. I will give all this.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King David replied to Araunah, ‘No, I insist on paying the full price. I will not take for the Lord what is yours, or sacrifice a burnt offering that costs me nothing.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David paid Araunah six hundred shekels of gold for the site.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David built an altar to the Lord there and sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings. He called on the Lord, and the Lord answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to the angel, and he put his sword back into its sheath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, when David saw that the Lord had answered him on the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tabernacle of the Lord, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering were at that time on the high place at Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David could not go before it to enquire of God, because he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, ‘The house of the Lord God is to be here, and also the altar of burnt offering for Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gave orders to assemble the foreigners residing in Israel, and from among them he appointed stonecutters to prepare dressed stone for building the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He provided a large amount of iron to make nails for the doors of the gateways and for the fittings, and more bronze than could be weighed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also provided more cedar logs than could be counted, for the Sidonians and Tyrians had brought large numbers of them to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, ‘My son Solomon is young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the Lord should be of great magnificence and fame and splendour in the sight of all the nations. Therefore I will make preparations for it.’ So David made extensive preparations before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for his son Solomon and charged him to build a house for the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Solomon: ‘My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the Name of the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this word of the Lord came to me: “You have shed much blood and have fought many wars. You are not to build a house for my Name, because you have shed much blood on the earth in my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will have a son who will be a man of peace and rest, and I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side. His name will be Solomon, and I will grant Israel peace and quiet during his reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one who will build a house for my Name. He will be my son, and I will be his father. And I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Now, my son, the Lord be with you, and may you have success and build the house of the Lord your God, as he said you would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord give you discretion and understanding when he puts you in command over Israel, so that you may keep the law of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will have success if you are careful to observe the decrees and laws that the Lord gave to Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I have taken great pains to provide for the temple of the Lord a hundred thousand talents of gold, a million talents of silver, quantities of bronze and iron too great to be weighed, and wood and stone. And you may add to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have many workers: stonecutters, masons and carpenters, as well as those skilled in every kind of work
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in gold and silver, bronze and iron – craftsmen beyond number. Now begin the work, and the Lord be with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David ordered all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, ‘Is not the Lord your God with you? And has he not granted you rest on every side? For he has given the inhabitants of the land into my hands, and the land is subject to the Lord and to his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now devote your heart and soul to seeking the Lord your God. Begin to build the sanctuary of the Lord God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord and the sacred articles belonging to God into the temple that will be built for the Name of the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was old and full of years, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also gathered together all the leaders of Israel, as well as the priests and Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites thirty years old or more were counted, and the total number of men was thirty-eight thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, ‘Of these, twenty-four thousand are to be in charge of the work of the temple of the Lord and six thousand are to be officials and judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four thousand are to be gatekeepers and four thousand are to praise the Lord with the musical instruments I have provided for that purpose.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David separated the Levites into divisions corresponding to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Belonging to the Gershonites:
Ladan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ladan:
Jehiel the first, Zetham and Joel – three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shimei:
Shelomoth, Haziel and Haran – three in all.
These were the heads of the families of Ladan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the sons of Shimei:
Jahath, Ziza, Jeush and Beriah.
These were the sons of Shimei – four in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jahath was the first and Ziza the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons; so they were counted as one family with one assignment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kohath:
Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel – four in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Amram:
Aaron and Moses.
Aaron was set apart, he and his descendants for ever, to consecrate the most holy things, to offer sacrifices before the Lord, to minister before him and to pronounce blessings in his name for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Moses the man of God were counted as part of the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Moses:
Gershom and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Gershom:
Shubael was the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The descendants of Eliezer:
Rehabiah was the first.
Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Izhar:
Shelomith was the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Hebron:
Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Uzziel:
Micah the first and Ishiah the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari:
Mahli and Mushi.
The sons of Mahli:
Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar died without having sons: he had only daughters. Their cousins, the sons of Kish, married them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Mushi:
Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth – three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the descendants of Levi by their families – the heads of families as they were registered under their names and counted individually, that is, the workers twenty years old or more who served in the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David had said, ‘Since the Lord, the God of Israel, has granted rest to his people and has come to dwell in Jerusalem for ever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle or any of the articles used in its service.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the last instructions of David, the Levites were counted from those twenty years old or more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The duty of the Levites was to help Aaron’s descendants in the service of the temple of the Lord: to be in charge of the courtyards, the side rooms, the purification of all sacred things and the performance of other duties at the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were in charge of the bread set out on the table, the special flour for the grain offerings, the thin loaves made without yeast, the baking and the mixing, and all measurements of quantity and size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were also to stand every morning to thank and praise the Lord. They were to do the same in the evening
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whenever burnt offerings were presented to the Lord on the Sabbaths, at the New Moon feasts and at the appointed festivals. They were to serve before the Lord regularly in the proper number and in the way prescribed for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so the Levites carried out their responsibilities for the tent of meeting, for the Holy Place and, under their relatives the descendants of Aaron, for the service of the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the divisions of the descendants of Aaron:
The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father did, and they had no sons; so Eleazar and Ithamar served as the priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the help of Zadok a descendant of Eleazar and Ahimelek a descendant of Ithamar, David separated them into divisions for their appointed order of ministering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A larger number of leaders were found among Eleazar’s descendants than among Ithamar’s, and they were divided accordingly: sixteen heads of families from Eleazar’s descendants and eight heads of families from Ithamar’s descendants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They divided them impartially by casting lots, for there were officials of the sanctuary and officials of God among the descendants of both Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The scribe Shemaiah son of Nethanel, a Levite, recorded their names in the presence of the king and of the officials: Zadok the priest, Ahimelek son of Abiathar and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites – one family being taken from Eleazar and then one from Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first lot fell to Jehoiarib,
the second to Jedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the third to Harim,
the fourth to Seorim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifth to Malkijah,
the sixth to Mijamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the seventh to Hakkoz,
the eighth to Abijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the ninth to Jeshua,
the tenth to Shekaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the eleventh to Eliashib,
the twelfth to Jakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the thirteenth to Huppah,
the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifteenth to Bilgah,
the sixteenth to Immer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the seventeenth to Hezir,
the eighteenth to Happizzez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the nineteenth to Pethahiah,
the twentieth to Jehezkel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the twenty-first to Jakin,
the twenty-second to Gamul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the twenty-third to Delaiah
and the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was their appointed order of ministering when they entered the temple of the Lord, according to the regulations prescribed for them by their ancestor Aaron, as the Lord, the God of Israel, had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for Rehabiah, from his sons:
Ishiah was the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the Izharites: Shelomoth;
from the sons of Shelomoth: Jahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Uzziel: Micah;
from the sons of Micah: Shamir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The brother of Micah: Ishiah;
from the sons of Ishiah: Zechariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi.
The son of Jaaziah: Beno.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari:
from Jaaziah: Beno, Shoham, Zakkur and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From Kish: the son of Kish:
Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth.
These were the Levites, according to their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also cast lots, just as their relatives the descendants of Aaron did, in the presence of King David and of Zadok, Ahimelek, and the heads of families of the priests and of the Levites. The families of the eldest brother were treated the same as those of the youngest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David, together with the commanders of the army, set apart some of the sons of Asaph, Heman and Jeduthun for the ministry of prophesying, accompanied by harps, lyres and cymbals. Here is the list of the men who performed this service:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the sons of Asaph:
Zakkur, Joseph, Nethaniah and Asarelah. The sons of Asaph were under the supervision of Asaph, who prophesied under the king’s supervision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Jeduthun, from his sons:
Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah and Mattithiah, six in all, under the supervision of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied, using the harp in thanking and praising the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Heman, from his sons:
Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shubael and Jerimoth; Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti and Romamti-Ezer; Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir and Mahazioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (All these were sons of Heman the king’s seer. They were given to him through the promises of God to exalt him. God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All these men were under the supervision of their father for the music of the temple of the Lord, with cymbals, lyres and harps, for the ministry at the house of God.
Asaph, Jeduthun and Heman were under the supervision of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along with their relatives – all of them trained and skilled in music for the Lord – they numbered 288.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Young and old alike, teacher as well as student, cast lots for their duties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first lot, which was for Asaph, fell to Joseph, his sons and relatives12 the second to Gedaliah, him and his relatives and sons 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third to Zakkur, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth to Izri, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventh to Jesarelah, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tenth to Shimei, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the thirteenth to Shubael, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourteenth to Mattithiah, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifteenth to Jerimoth, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-first to Hothir, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-second to Giddalti, his sons and relatives 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-third to Mahazioth, his sons and relatives12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-fourth to Romamti-Ezer, his sons and relatives. 12
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The divisions of the gatekeepers:
from the Korahites: Meshelemiah son of Kore, one of the sons of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meshelemiah had sons:
Zechariah the firstborn,
Jediael the second,
Zebadiah the third,
Jathniel the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Elam the fifth,
Jehohanan the sixth
and Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Obed-Edom also had sons:
Shemaiah the firstborn,
Jehozabad the second,
Joah the third,
Sakar the fourth,
Nethanel the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ammiel the sixth,
Issachar the seventh
and Peullethai the eighth.
(For God had blessed Obed-Edom.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obed-Edom’s son Shemaiah also had sons, who were leaders in their father’s family because they were very capable men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed and Elzabad; his relatives Elihu and Semakiah were also able men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were descendants of Obed-Edom; they and their sons and their relatives were capable men with the strength to do the work – descendants of Obed-Edom, 62 in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshelemiah had sons and relatives, who were able men – 18 in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hosah the Merarite had sons: Shimri the first (although he was not the firstborn, his father had appointed him the first),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tabaliah the third and Zechariah the fourth. The sons and relatives of Hosah were 13 in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These divisions of the gatekeepers, through their leaders, had duties for ministering in the temple of the Lord, just as their relatives had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lots were cast for each gate, according to their families, young and old alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah. Then lots were cast for his son Zechariah, a wise counsellor, and the lot for the North Gate fell to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot for the South Gate fell to Obed-Edom, and the lot for the storehouse fell to his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lots for the West Gate and the Shalleketh Gate on the upper road fell to Shuppim and Hosah.
Guard was alongside guard:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: there were six Levites a day on the east, four a day on the north, four a day on the south and two at a time at the storehouse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the court to the west, there were four at the road and two at the court itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers who were descendants of Korah and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their fellow Levites were in charge of the treasuries of the house of God and the treasuries for the dedicated things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Ladan, who were Gershonites through Ladan and who were heads of families belonging to Ladan the Gershonite, were Jehieli,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sons of Jehieli, Zetham and his brother Joel. They were in charge of the treasuries of the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites and the Uzzielites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shubael, a descendant of Gershom son of Moses, was the official in charge of the treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His relatives through Eliezer: Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zikri his son and Shelomith his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelomith and his relatives were in charge of all the treasuries for the things dedicated by King David, by the heads of families who were the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and by the other army commanders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the plunder taken in battle they dedicated for the repair of the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everything dedicated by Samuel the seer and by Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner and Joab son of Zeruiah, and all the other dedicated things were in the care of Shelomith and his relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Izharites: Kenaniah and his sons were assigned duties away from the temple, as officials and judges over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his relatives – seventeen hundred able men – were responsible in Israel west of the Jordan for all the work of the Lord and for the king’s service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the Hebronites, Jeriah was their chief according to the genealogical records of their families. In the fortieth year of David’s reign a search was made in the records, and capable men among the Hebronites were found at Jazer in Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeriah had two thousand seven hundred relatives, who were able men and heads of families, and King David put them in charge of the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh for every matter pertaining to God and for the affairs of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the list of the Israelites – heads of families, commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and their officers, who served the king in all that concerned the army divisions that were on duty month by month throughout the year. Each division consisted of 24,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In charge of the first division, for the first month, was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a descendant of Perez and chief of all the army officers for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In charge of the division for the second month was Dodai the Ahohite; Mikloth was the leader of his division. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third army commander, for the third month, was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the priest. He was chief and there were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the Benaiah who was a mighty warrior among the Thirty and was over the Thirty. His son Ammizabad was in charge of his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth, for the fourth month, was Asahel the brother of Joab; his son Zebadiah was his successor. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth, for the fifth month, was the commander Shamhuth the Izrahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth, for the sixth month, was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh, for the seventh month, was Helez the Pelonite, an Ephraimite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth, for the eighth month, was Sibbekai the Hushathite, a Zerahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth, for the ninth month, was Abiezer the Anathothite, a Benjaminite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth, for the tenth month, was Maharai the Netophathite, a Zerahite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, was Benaiah the Pirathonite, an Ephraimite. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, was Heldai the Netophathite, from the family of Othniel. There were 24,000 men in his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
over Levi: Hashabiah son of Kemuel;
over Aaron: Zadok;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over Judah: Elihu, a brother of David;
over Issachar: Omri son of Michael;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over Zebulun: Ishmaiah son of Obadiah;
over Naphtali: Jerimoth son of Azriel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over the Ephraimites: Hoshea son of Azaziah;
over half the tribe of Manasseh: Joel son of Pedaiah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead: Iddo son of Zechariah;
over Benjamin: Jaasiel son of Abner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over Dan: Azarel son of Jeroham.
These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David did not take the number of the men twenty years old or less, because the Lord had promised to make Israel as numerous as the stars in the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah began to count the men but did not finish. God’s wrath came on Israel on account of this numbering, and the number was not entered in the book of the annals of King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the royal storehouses.
Jonathan son of Uzziah was in charge of the storehouses in the outlying districts, in the towns, the villages and the watchtowers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezri son of Kelub was in charge of the workers who farmed the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shimei the Ramathite was in charge of the vineyards.
Zabdi the Shiphmite was in charge of the produce of the vineyards for the wine vats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Baal-Hanan the Gederite was in charge of the olive and sycamore-fig trees in the western foothills.
Joash was in charge of the supplies of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shitrai the Sharonite was in charge of the herds grazing in Sharon.
Shaphat son of Adlai was in charge of the herds in the valleys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels.
Jehdeiah the Meronothite was in charge of the donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jaziz the Hagrite was in charge of the flocks.
All these were the officials in charge of King David’s property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counsellor, a man of insight and a scribe. Jehiel son of Hakmoni took care of the king’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahithophel was the king’s counsellor.
Hushai the Arkite was the king’s confidant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahithophel was succeeded by Jehoiada son of Benaiah and by Abiathar.
Joab was the commander of the royal army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David summoned all the officials of Israel to assemble at Jerusalem: the officers over the tribes, the commanders of the divisions in the service of the king, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and the officials in charge of all the property and livestock belonging to the king and his sons, together with the palace officials, the warriors and all the brave fighting men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David rose to his feet and said: ‘Listen to me, my fellow Israelites, my people. I had it in my heart to build a house as a place of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord, for the footstool of our God, and I made plans to build it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to me, “You are not to build a house for my Name, because you are a warrior and have shed blood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Yet the Lord, the God of Israel, chose me from my whole family to be king over Israel for ever. He chose Judah as leader, and from the tribe of Judah he chose my family, and from my father’s sons he was pleased to make me king over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of all my sons – and the Lord has given me many – he has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, “Solomon your son is the one who will build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will establish his kingdom for ever if he is unswerving in carrying out my commands and laws, as is being done at this time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘So now I charge you in the sight of all Israel and of the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God: be careful to follow all the commands of the Lord your God, that you may possess this good land and pass it on as an inheritance to your descendants for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And you, my son Solomon, acknowledge the God of your father, and serve him with wholehearted devotion and with a willing mind, for the Lord searches every heart and understands every desire and every thought. If you seek him, he will be found by you; but if you forsake him, he will reject you for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a house as the sanctuary. Be strong and do the work.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David gave his son Solomon the plans for the portico of the temple, its buildings, its storerooms, its upper parts, its inner rooms and the place of atonement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him the plans of all that the Spirit had put in his mind for the courts of the temple of the Lord and all the surrounding rooms, for the treasuries of the temple of God and for the treasuries for the dedicated things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him instructions for the divisions of the priests and Levites, and for all the work of serving in the temple of the Lord, as well as for all the articles to be used in its service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He designated the weight of gold for all the gold articles to be used in various kinds of service, and the weight of silver for all the silver articles to be used in various kinds of service:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight of gold for the gold lampstands and their lamps, with the weight for each lampstand and its lamps; and the weight of silver for each silver lampstand and its lamps, according to the use of each lampstand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight of gold for each table for consecrated bread; the weight of silver for the silver tables;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight of pure gold for the forks, sprinkling bowls and pitchers; the weight of gold for each gold dish; the weight of silver for each silver dish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the weight of the refined gold for the altar of incense. He also gave him the plan for the chariot, that is, the cherubim of gold that spread their wings and overshadow the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘All this,’ David said, ‘I have in writing as a result of the Lord’s hand on me, and he enabled me to understand all the details of the plan.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David also said to Solomon his son, ‘Be strong and courageous, and do the work. Do not be afraid or discouraged, for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you until all the work for the service of the temple of the Lord is finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The divisions of the priests and Levites are ready for all the work on the temple of God, and every willing person skilled in any craft will help you in all the work. The officials and all the people will obey your every command.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David said to the whole assembly: ‘My son Solomon, the one whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced. The task is great, because this palatial structure is not for man but for the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With all my resources I have provided for the temple of my God – gold for the gold work, silver for the silver, bronze for the bronze, iron for the iron and wood for the wood, as well as onyx for the settings, turquoise, stones of various colours, and all kinds of fine stone and marble – all of these in large quantities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, in my devotion to the temple of my God I now give my personal treasures of gold and silver for the temple of my God, over and above everything I have provided for this holy temple:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three thousand talents of gold (gold of Ophir) and seven thousand talents of refined silver, for the overlaying of the walls of the buildings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the gold work and the silver work, and for all the work to be done by the craftsmen. Now, who is willing to consecrate themselves to the Lord today?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders of families, the officers of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds, and the officials in charge of the king’s work gave willingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave towards the work on the temple of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze and a hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the temple of the Lord in the custody of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people rejoiced at the willing response of their leaders, for they had given freely and wholeheartedly to the Lord. David the king also rejoiced greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David praised the Lord in the presence of the whole assembly, saying,
‘Praise be to you, Lord,
    the God of our father Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yours, Lord, is the greatness and the power
    and the glory and the majesty and the splendour,
    for everything in heaven and earth is yours.
Yours, Lord, is the kingdom;
    you are exalted as head over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth and honour come from you;
    you are the ruler of all things.
In your hands are strength and power
    to exalt and give strength to all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, our God, we give you thanks,
    and praise your glorious name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to give as generously as this? Everything comes from you, and we have given you only what comes from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are foreigners and strangers in your sight, as were all our ancestors. Our days on earth are like a shadow, without hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord our God, all this abundance that we have provided for building you a temple for your Holy Name comes from your hand, and all of it belongs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know, my God, that you test the heart and are pleased with integrity. All these things I have given willingly and with honest intent. And now I have seen with joy how willingly your people who are here have given to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord, the God of our fathers Abraham, Isaac and Israel, keep these desires and thoughts in the hearts of your people for ever, and keep their hearts loyal to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And give my son Solomon the wholehearted devotion to keep your commands, statutes and decrees and to do everything to build the palatial structure for which I have provided.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to the whole assembly, ‘Praise the Lord your God.’ So they all praised the Lord, the God of their fathers; they bowed down, prostrating themselves before the Lord and the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day they made sacrifices to the Lord and presented burnt offerings to him: a thousand bulls, a thousand rams and a thousand male lambs, together with their drink offerings, and other sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They ate and drank with great joy in the presence of the Lord that day.
Then they acknowledged Solomon son of David as king a second time, anointing him before the Lord to be ruler and Zadok to be priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord as king in place of his father David. He prospered and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the officers and warriors, as well as all of King David’s sons, pledged their submission to King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel and bestowed on him royal splendour such as no king over Israel ever had before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David son of Jesse was king over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ruled over Israel for forty years – seven in Hebron and thirty-three in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He died at a good old age, having enjoyed long life, wealth and honour. His son Solomon succeeded him as king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the events of King David’s reign, from beginning to end, they are written in the records of Samuel the seer, the records of Nathan the prophet and the records of Gad the seer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: together with the details of his reign and power, and the circumstances that surrounded him and Israel and the kingdoms of all the other lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
